Author: Seko#7408
Content:
How safe do you think the ledger is? Especially with regard to privacy? Do you think Ledger logs the addresses and can assign them to a user? Do you think, they save the IP addresses? 
I'm currently wondering how anonymous is Ledger? After all, the Hardware Wallet is ordered and paid for with KYC!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not sure if the hardware id is sent with the requests to their servers

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but all tx by ledger needs their servers to provide the rawtx to sign

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which means ip addresses can be logged and if they are keeping logs, and USSA demands they divulge it, likely to avoid being waterboarded, they will divulge what info they have

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: thinking about this, it would not be surprising if ledger wasnt forced to log the hardware id, if they werent

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but i have no actual knowledge about this, just guessing that they can easily be forced to log all this and divulge all the details, in fact with the recent FATF they are likely forced to divulge all such data to chainanalysis

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is best to use a dedicated full node!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: still it can be monitored externally, but at least you are not handing it on a silver platter

Author: tryx#8532
Content: Hello, Just made a "lost founds -5 June" request, I've added a new address from Binance. Is that ok ? or I have to redo the request and put a walled address. Thanks!

Author: tryx#8532
Content: wallet*

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: any valid address is fine, the important thing is that it matches the address you send to from the old address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a small amount was sent to all the compromised addresses. send it to the new address you claimed

Author: tryx#8532
Content: ok, thanks , will get right on that
